📏 How to Measure

Chest/Bust

Measure around the fullest part of your chest, keeping the measuring tape horizontal.

Waist

Measure around your natural waistline, keeping the tape comfortably loose.

Hip

Measure around the fullest part of your hips, approximately 8 inches below your waist.

Inseam

Measure from the top of your inner thigh down to your ankle bone.

👔 Fit Types

Slim Fit

Tailored close to the body with minimal ease. Best for lean builds.

Regular Fit

Classic fit with comfortable room through chest and waist. Most versatile option.

Relaxed Fit

Loose, comfortable fit with extra room. Ideal for layering and casual wear.

Care Instructions for {product_name}

Keep your garment looking its best with proper care. Follow these guidelines to maintain quality and extend the life of your clothing.

🏷️ Care Symbols Guide

🌊

Washing

  • Cold Water (30°C): Gentle on fabrics and colors
  • Warm Water (40°C): For normal soil and cotton items
  • Hot Water (60°C): For white cotton and heavily soiled items
  • Hand Wash Only: Delicate items requiring gentle care
🌀

Drying

  • Tumble Dry Low: Gentle heat to prevent shrinkage
  • Tumble Dry Medium: Normal heat for everyday items
  • Air Dry: Hang or lay flat to preserve shape
  • Do Not Tumble Dry: Air dry only to prevent damage
🔥

Ironing

  • Low Heat (110°C): Synthetic fabrics and acetate
  • Medium Heat (150°C): Wool, silk, and polyester
  • High Heat (200°C): Cotton and linen
  • Do Not Iron: Heat-sensitive materials
🧴

Professional Care

  • Dry Clean Only: Professional cleaning required
  • Wet Clean: Professional water-based cleaning
  • Do Not Dry Clean: Avoid chemical solvents
  • Specialist Care: Leather, suede, or technical fabrics

🧵 Fabric-Specific Guidelines

Cotton & Cotton Blends

Washing: Machine wash in cold to warm water with like colors

Drying: Tumble dry low or air dry to prevent shrinkage

Ironing: Medium to high heat while slightly damp

Storage: Fold or hang in cool, dry place

Wool & Wool Blends

Washing: Hand wash in cold water or gentle machine cycle

Drying: Lay flat to dry, never wring or twist

Ironing: Low to medium heat with pressing cloth

Storage: Fold with cedar blocks to prevent moths

Synthetic Fabrics

Washing: Machine wash cold, separate from natural fibers

Drying: Low heat tumble dry or air dry

Ironing: Low heat, use pressing cloth if needed

Storage: Hang to prevent permanent creases

Delicate Fabrics (Silk, Lace)

Washing: Hand wash with gentle detergent or dry clean

Drying: Air dry away from direct sunlight

Ironing: Low heat on reverse side with pressing cloth

Storage: Hang with padded hangers or fold in tissue

🧽 Stain Removal Guide

Common Stains & Solutions

  • Blood: Rinse with cold water immediately, then wash in cold water
  • Oil/Grease: Apply dish soap directly, let sit 10 minutes, then wash
  • Sweat: Pre-treat with white vinegar solution before washing
  • Makeup: Use makeup remover or gentle soap before washing
  • Food Stains: Rinse immediately with cold water, pre-treat as needed
  • Ink: Dab with rubbing alcohol, do not rub, then wash

⚡ Quick Tips

  • Always treat stains immediately for best results
  • Never use hot water on protein-based stains (blood, sweat)
  • Test any treatment on an inconspicuous area first
  • Blot, don't rub, to avoid spreading the stain

🗓️ Seasonal Care Tips

Spring/Summer Storage

  • Clean before storing winter items
  • Use breathable garment bags
  • Add cedar blocks or lavender sachets
  • Store in cool, dry location

Fall/Winter Preparation

  • Air out stored items before wearing
  • Check for moth damage or stains
  • Professional cleaning for heavy coats
  • Waterproof outer garments as needed
